summary: "Ben-Hur" is a 1959 religious epic film directed by William Wyler and starring Charlton Heston. It's based on Lew Wallace's novel and remakes a 1925 silent film. With a huge budget, it had grand sets and costumes, and used over 10,000 extras and 2,500 horses. The nine-minute chariot race is iconic. The film was a big success, winning 11 Academy Awards and becoming the second highest-grossing film at the time. It's now preserved in the National Film Registry for its cultural importance.
title: Ben-Hur (1959 film)
